p: The methanol extract of the rhizome of C. xanthorrhiza and its active constituent germacrone ( Figure 1) have demonstrated anti-inflammatory effects [ 52]. In high-fat diet (HFD)-induced obese mice, the anti-inflammatory action of xanthorrhizol (XAN) and a C. xanthorrhiza extract (CXE) was investigated in a study with standardized XAN on inflammatory markers, where XAN and CXE significantly inhibited the production of inflammatory cytokines, such as TNF-α, IL-6, IL-1β, and C-reactive protein (CRP) in adipose tissue, liver, and muscle [ 53].
